message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the problem of distributed convergence to efficient outcomes in coordination games through dynamics based on aspiration learning. This involves the use of Markov chains and analysis of their asymptotic behavior, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). The paper also discusses the use of aspiration learning, which is a type of machine learning algorithm (cs.AI) and involves the use of simulations and analysis of behavior (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper deals with the concept of fairness in coordination games, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI) and multi-agent systems (cs.MA).
